item.title: Configure Function Keys Keychron on Linux
item.description: #how-to #os/linux #tech/hardware hold for 4 seconds fn + X + L in a terminal execute and test the function keys 1 echo 0 | sudo tee /sys/module/hid_apple/parameters/fnmode and then this, to make it permanent 1 2 echo "options hid_apple fnmode=0" | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.

item.title: how to configure rufus to install kali linux
item.description: #os/linux #bios open rufus select you kali image select your device (USB) partition scheme as “MBR” Target system as BIOS or UEFI label it file system as FAT32 (default) cluster size as 8192 bytes (default) References steps to create a kali bootable usb with rufus

item.title: How to open a particular file from a terminal
item.description: #os/linux How to open a particular file from a terminal Extracts xdg-open to open any file in ubuntu References source https://superuser.
